doc:
Tex Terry https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tex_Terry 0 Edward Earl Terry (August 22, 1902 – May 18, 1985), known professionally as Tex Terry, was an American film actor who often played a henchman in B-movie Westerns during the 1940s and 1950s. Terry was born in Coxville, Indiana. In 1964, he married Isabel Draesemer, a Hollywood agent. Terry made his last movie in 1972. In 1979, he and his wife moved back to Indiana, where he opened Tex's Longhorn Tavern. Every August he invited the public to celebrate his birthday by listening to him tell Hollywood stories and watching his movies. He died in Terre Haute, Indiana on May 18, 1985, and is buried at Coxville Cemetery in Coxville, Indiana. Edward_Earl_Terry ( August_22_,_1902 – May_18_,_1985 ) , known professionally as Tex_Terry , was an_American_film_actor who often played a_henchman in B-movie_Westerns during the_1940s_and_1950s . Terry was_born in Coxville , Indiana . In 1964 , he married Isabel_Draesemer , a_Hollywood_agent . Terry made his_last_movie in 1972 . In 1979 , he and his_wife moved back to Indiana , where he opened Tex 's_Longhorn_Tavern . Every_August he invited the_public to_celebrate his_birthday by listening to him tell Hollywood_stories and watching his_movies . He died in Terre_Haute , Indiana on May_18_,_1985 , and is_buried at Coxville_Cemetery in Coxville , Indiana .
